meanings.definition: A person who delays or postpones tasks or actions.
meanings.sent1: The procrastinator waited until the last minute to start his homework.
meanings.sent2: She is known as a procrastinator because she always leaves things for later.
meanings.sent3: The procrastinator joked that they would start exercising tomorrow, as always.
meanings.sent4: His inner procrastinator whispered that there was still plenty of time to finish the project.
meanings.sent5: The image of the procrastinator surrounded by unfinished work stuck in her mind.

meanings.definition: One who habitually puts off doing things.
meanings.sent1: As a procrastinator, he struggled to meet deadlines.
meanings.sent2: The office procrastinator always had an excuse for not starting the report.
meanings.sent3: The procrastinator playfully blamed the laundry pile for distracting them from work.
meanings.sent4: Her reputation as a procrastinator followed her wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The procrastinator's desk was cluttered with unfinished projects and unopened mail.
